SEARCH
Package Implementation

Class Commands

java.lang.Object
Implementation.Commands
public class Commands extends Object
The Commands class provides various command methods for interacting with the virtual pet game. These commands include actions like feeding the pet, playing with the pet, purchasing items, checking game progress, and managing parental controls. Each command returns a string message indicating the result of the operation.

  • Constructor Details

    • Commands

      public Commands(Implementation.Players players, Implementation.VirtualPets virtualPets, Implementation.Inventory inventory, Implementation.Store store, Implementation.GameProgress gameProgress, Implementation.ParentalControls parentalControls)
      Constructs a Commands object to initialize necessary services for command execution.
      Parameters:
      players - The Players object to manage player-related actions.
      virtualPets - The VirtualPets object to manage pet-related actions.
      inventory - The Inventory object to manage the player's inventory.
      store - The Store object to manage store inventory and prices.
      gameProgress - The GameProgress object to manage player progress.
      parentalControls - The ParentalControls object to manage parental settings.

  • Method Details

    • buyItem

      public String buyItem(String playerId, String itemId)
      Purchases an item from the store. If the player has enough currency, the item is added to the inventory.
      Parameters:
      playerId - The ID of the player buying the item.
      itemId - The ID of the item to purchase.
      Returns:
      A message indicating the result of the operation.

    • checkGameProgress

      public String[] checkGameProgress(String playerId)
      Checks the player's game progress, including level, experience, quests completed, and badges.
      Parameters:
      playerId - The ID of the player whose progress is to be checked.
      Returns:
      A string array containing player ID, level, experience, quests completed, and badges.

    • setPlaytimeLimit

      public void setPlaytimeLimit(String playerId, int minutes)
      Sets the playtime limit for the player by updating the parental controls.
      Parameters:
      playerId - The ID of the player whose playtime limit is being set.
      minutes - The new playtime limit in minutes.

    • enableParentalControls

      public boolean enableParentalControls(String playerId, boolean isEnabled)
      Enables or disables parental controls for the player by updating the corresponding setting.
      Parameters:
      playerId - The ID of the player whose parental controls are being modified.
      isEnabled - A boolean indicating whether to enable or disable parental controls.
      Returns:
      The updated status of parental controls for the player.

    • authenticateParentalControls

      public boolean authenticateParentalControls(String password)
      Authenticates a parental controls access attempt.
      Parameters:
      password - The password entered by the user.
      Returns:
      True if authentication is successful, false otherwise.

    • setAllowedPlayTime

      public String setAllowedPlayTime(String playerId, int startHour, int startMinute, int endHour, int endMinute)
      Sets the allowed play time range for a player.
      Parameters:
      playerId - The ID of the player.
      startHour - The starting hour (0-23) when play is allowed.
      startMinute - The starting minute (0-59) when play is allowed.
      endHour - The ending hour (0-23) when play is allowed.
      endMinute - The ending minute (0-59) when play is allowed.
      Returns:
      A message indicating the result of the operation.

    • isPlayTimeAllowed

      public boolean isPlayTimeAllowed(String playerId)
      Checks if the player has exceeded their maximum allowed playtime.
      Parameters:
      playerId - The ID of the player.
      Returns:
      True if the player is allowed to play, false if they've reached their limit.

    • updatePlayTimeStatistics

      public void updatePlayTimeStatistics(String playerId, int sessionDurationInMinutes)
      Updates play time statistics for a player session. This should be called when a gaming session ends.
      Parameters:
      playerId - The ID of the player.
      sessionDurationInMinutes - The duration of the current session in minutes.

    • resetPlayTimeStatistics

      public String resetPlayTimeStatistics(String playerId)
      Resets play time statistics for a player.
      Parameters:
      playerId - The ID of the player.
      Returns:
      A message indicating the result of the operation.

    • revivePet

      public String revivePet(String petId)
      Revives a pet and restores all its statistics to maximum values.
      Parameters:
      petId - The ID of the pet to revive.
      Returns:
      A message indicating the result of the operation.

    • updatePetStats

      public void updatePetStats(String petId, Implementation.VitalStats stats)
      Updates the pet's vital statistics in the backend.
      Parameters:
      petId - The ID of the pet.
      stats - The new vital statistics for the pet.

    • setMaxPlaytimeMinutes

      public String setMaxPlaytimeMinutes(String playerId, int minutes)
      Sets the maximum allowed playtime in minutes for a player.
      Parameters:
      playerId - The ID of the player.
      minutes - The maximum allowed playtime in minutes.
      Returns:
      A message indicating the result of the operation.
